function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reliance on unreliable energy supply","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of natural light on virus activity","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of wastewater and waste collection systems on virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of interior finishes on virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of differentiation between entrance and exit doors","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of safety distance markers in waiting areas and stops","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction of road width for wider pedestrian paths","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Distribution of public disinfectant containers or washing infrastructures","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"New pop-up service points for bicycle repairs and free water","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High population densities in urban areas","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased interaction between people due to urban design","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High-risk environment in public transport","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Historical lack of adoption of infection-fighting solutions","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of historical pandemics on urban design","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adaptation of historical structures for new roles","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extended urbanisation and informal public areas increase vulnerability to infectious diseases due to demographic factors, infrastructure, and governance.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Built environment can create conditions for the spread of specific diseases, such as legionnaire’s disease, through factors like air conditioning, indoor plumbing, and hot water systems.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Historical pandemic diseases have been influenced by the built environment, with measures such as quarantine, infrastructure improvements, and urban planning playing a role in disease management.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of infectious diseases in built environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contaminated water supply leading to disease outbreak","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor sanitation and sewage management leading to disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sunlight and ventilation in buildings contributing to the spread of tuberculosis","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor city planning and sanitation leading to rapid spread of plague and cholera","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Miasma theory leading to ineffective disease prevention measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misunderstanding of disease transmission routes leading to ineffective containment measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid spread of gastrointestinal problems and fevers associated with infectious diseases such as dysentery or typhoid among the legions or in military camps.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Outbreaks of the bubonic plague devastating europe in the mid-fourteenth century, causing the death of millions of people.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of the bubonic plague through trade routes, mainly via fleas carried by rats and other infected animals.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risks associated with the potential failure of solutions to reduce covid-19 risks over time","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks of inadequate solutions leading to ongoing covid-19 transmission","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks of overlooking broader sustainability in the pursuit of covid-19 risk reduction","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations and deficiencies of buildings in urban sustainability in the built environment","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential contamination by covid-19 and other fresh outbreaks of the virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deficiencies of buildings and the built environment revealed during covid-19 lockdown","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of focus on built environment in covid-19 research","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of sustainable development in risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Globalization leading to increased movement of people and goods, and rapid dissemination of ideas, increasing the potential for transmission of infectious microorganisms.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited focus on the built environment in covid-19 research and publications, with less than 1% of articles addressing risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear efficacy of protection against re-infections in people with and without symptoms at their initial sars-cov-2 infection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accumulating evidence on the efficacy and duration of natural immunity contributing to the mitigation of the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete vaccination data due to vaccinations taking place outside of the health system","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower testing frequency in previously sars-cov-2 infected participants versus the control group","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Seroprevalence surveys suggesting higher
